Package com.appglu.android.sync

Contains the Sync API implementation for Android.
The Sync API is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
SyncRepository  
SyncTransactionCallback  
 

Class Summary
Column  
ContentValuesRowMapper  
SQLiteSyncRepository  
StorageFileTableChangesCallback  
SyncApi SyncApi is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
Before using SyncApi you must first create a SQLite database, extending SyncDatabaseHelper.
SyncBroadcastReceiver Create a sub-class of SyncBroadcastReceiver to receive broadcast events from SyncIntentService.
SyncDatabaseHelper SyncDatabaseHelper extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper to provide custom functionality: it creates meta-data tables required to perform a Sync operation with the AppGlu server.
SyncExceptionWrapper Wraps an exception thrown by the SyncApi to provide a easy way of extracting error code and error messages.
SyncFileStorageService  
SyncIntentFilter Use this IntentFilter to register a SyncBroadcastReceiver.
SyncIntentService This is the Android service responsible for executing the Sync operation with the AppGlu server.
SyncIntentServiceRequest Describes what the SyncIntentService is going to do during the Sync operation.
SyncService  
TableColumns  
 

Enum Summary
SyncExceptionWrapper.SyncErrorCode  
 

Exception Summary
SyncFileStorageException  
SyncRepositoryException  
 

Package com.appglu.android.sync Description

Contains the Sync API implementation for Android.
The Sync API is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
SyncApi
